Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Des(8â€“14)brevinin-1PMa (natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXU; 1S=S, UCSS1a; more AMPs? Brevinin-1PMb; Brevinin-1PMc)
Sequence Information.Source: the Amazon River frog,Lithobates palmipes(Ranidae), South America

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (70.83%) toBrevinin-1PMaI=K: 18%; F=L=A=C: 12%. GRAVY: 1.22; Mol Wt:  1852.374; Mol formula: C88H146N20O19S2; mol ex coeff: 125. It has a segment deletion compared to the WT.Discovery: isolated from frog skin secretions.Activity: active against E. coli ATCC 35218 (MIC 62.5 uM), S. aureus ATCC 12600 (MIC 31.3 uM), and E.faecium ATCC 19434 (MIC 125 uM).In vitro toxicity: female murine RBC: HC50 >200 uM, not hemo.lytic.Brevinin-1PMb and Brevinin-1PMc: antimicrobial activity not tested.  Est. 3/2023
Literature Information.Author: Mechkarska M, Barran G, Kolodziejek J, Coquet L, Leprince J, Jouenne T, Nowotny N, Conlon JM. 2023
Literature Information.Reference: Comp Biochem Physiol Part D Genomics Proteomics. 2023 Feb 24;46:101069. doi: 10.1016/j.cbd.2023.101069.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Peptidomic analysis of the host-defense peptides in skin secretions of the Amazon River frog Lithobates palmipes (Ranidae).
